title: How Dinosaurs Became Birds
description: A quick, practical guide to How Dinosaurs Became Birds.

hook.text: Dinosaurs didn't all go extinct. You see their descendants every day â€” they're called birds.

buildup.text: Small theropod dinosaurs began evolving feathers millions of years before the asteroid hit.

discovery.text: Feathers originally evolved for warmth or display â€” not flight.

twist.text: Archaeopteryx, from 150 million years ago, had feathers, wings, teeth, and a bony tail.

climax.text: After the asteroid wiped out large dinosaurs, small feathered ones diversified into 10,000 bird species.

punchline.text: Your backyard chicken is a dinosaur. Evolution added feathers and removed teeth.
